ibis.constellation.util

Class FlexibleEventCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.constellation.Activity
      • ibis.constellation.util.FlexibleEventCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FlexibleEventCollector
extends Activity
    A FlexibleEventCollector is an Activity that just waits for events, indefinitely, and collects them. It provides a method waitForEvents(), to be used by other activities, to collect the events collected so far.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlexibleEventCollector

        public FlexibleEventCollector(AbstractContext c)
        Constructs a FlexibleEventCollector with the specified activity context. Note: this is an activity that will receive events (see Activity.Activity(AbstractContext, boolean)).
        Parameters:
        c - the activity context

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public int initialize(Constellation c)
        Description copied from class: Activity
        The implementation of this method should perform the initial processing when the activity is first activated. It may perform as much processing as needed, but should not block for a prolonged period, as this may result in deadlocks. When finished, it should return either Activity.SUSPEND or Activity.FINISH, depending on what the activity is to do next: Activity.SUSPEND when it wants to wait for events, and Activity.FINISH when it is done. Note that this method does not throw checked exceptions. It can, however, throw runtime exceptions or errors, and the Constellation running this Activity will deal with that.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class Activity
        Parameters:
        c - the Constellation on which the Activity is running
        Returns:
        either FINISH if this Activity is done or SUSPEND if this Activity expects events.

      • process

        public int process(Constellation c,
                   Event e)
        Description copied from class: Activity
        The implementation of this method is called when an event is received for this activity. After the event is processed it must return Activity.SUSPEND or Activity.FINISH, depending on what the activity is to do next: Activity.SUSPEND when it expects other events, and Activity.FINISH when it is done. This method is invoked once at a time, even if more events arrive more or less simultaneously. Note that this method does not throw checked exceptions. It can, however, throw runtime exceptions or errors, and the Constellation running this Activity will deal with that.
        Specified by:
        process in class Activity
        Parameters:
        c - the Constellation on which the Activity is running
        e - the Event to process.
        Returns:
        either FINISH if this Activity is done or SUSPEND if this Activity expects events.

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup(Constellation c)
        Description copied from class: Activity
        The implementation of this method is called when the activity is finished. It allows the activity to perform cleanup, and, for example, send events to its parent activity. Note that this method does not throw checked exceptions. It can, however, throw runtime exceptions or errors, and the Constellation running this Activity will deal with that.
        Specified by:
        cleanup in class Activity
        Parameters:
        c - the Constellation on which the Activity is running

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • waitForEvents

        public Event[] waitForEvents()
        This method blocks waiting for events. As soon as one or more are available, it creates an array containing these events, clears the event list of this collector, and returns the array.
        Returns:
        an array containing the received events.
